name: Super Decameron Marazul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been a month now since returning from our vacation to San Andres Island.We booked a last minute package with only a little knowledge of the island.Needless to say,we were a touch nervous as we had seen some divided reviews on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Marazul Magic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hopefully,our review will educate any vacationers on this little treasure of an island,as well as giving some helpful pointers on the Decameron experience.
reviews.title: What an Island

likes.liked: — Being able to get our of the facility and enjoy the Island without any worries
likes.disliked: — The Hotel really needs to fix up the rooms, expecially the bathrooms

reviews.text: As you may have read or heard already,if you book one of the Decameron hotels you can enjoy the amenities at any of the properties.We found this to be a very positive experience as every property as it's negative and positive aspects.This also lent to a communal atmosphere amongst the Decameron guests as we met nearly everybody staying at the hotels.There is a free shuttle that transported guests from hotel to hotel which we took often,however,we did take many taxis as well as this was much faster and a more interesting way to see the island and meet the locals.Our taxis never cost more than $4.
reviews.title: Karen in London
loved it
reviews.text: After checking out all the other Decameron properties we were very happy we chose the Marazul.It is easily the nicest of the hotels with great restaurants and good service.A little off the beaten path(approx.10 min. from downtown) it is a quiet(but not boring)piece of heaven.Our room was clean with a nice balcony that overlooked a bevy of palm trees.Mind you we spent little time there as we were usually snorkelling.One of the best features of the Marazul is the free boat shuttle by Mario to Acuario and Haynes Cay.These gorgeous,little coral outcroppings made the trip totally worth it by themselves.The snorkelling was magnificent(San Andres is home to the 3rd largest live coral reef in the world) and was much better than anywhere in the Bahamas,Mexico or the Caribbean that I have been.

The only negative to Marazul was the beach.The water was full of seaweed and the beach was tiny.But we would combat this by taking a shuttle to the San Luis or the Isleno to enjoy their beach for a few hours.
reviews.title: San Andres; so much to see for so little a price
Loved the Marazul
reviews.text: Just got back from San Andres, we stayed at the Marazul it was the best of the 5 hotel's as far as accomadations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and the people as a whole in town were great.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Laid Back

likes.liked: — Laid back & easy going vacation destination
likes.disliked: — Had to wait 2+ hrs for room. Not fault of hotel as flight arrives late morning.

reviews.text: The only problem is if you are looking for long white sandy beach's you will not find them here. there are a few great beach's but you have to take a 5 minute bus ride to Rockey Key or a 15 minute ride to Islano's (public beach) Rockey key is the best as you can book lunch with your hotel and enjoy the beach.
reviews.title: Loved It!!

likes.disliked: — no internet but there is internet cafe's in town

reviews.title: Overall good
reviews.text: Beach vendors don't bother you once you tell them you don't want anything.If you go to Rocky Key buy a beach rapp from Lewis he is very friendly and a very good price.If you buy something from Lewis tell him the guy from Canada who gave him a birthday present sent you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They all speak English, make sure you convert your money into peso's much easier to deal with.
reviews.title: Marazul Perfect For Us...

likes.liked: — Great food, staff, shuttles to other properties, inexpensive taxis.
likes.disliked: — beds hard and entertainment only ok

reviews.text: Hotel was average, about what I expected for a central-american budget resort.
reviews.title: Budget get-away

likes.disliked: — Lack of sound insulation in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large with comfortable king bed, a/c that worked well, fridge that had a gallon jug of drinking water (complimentary). Bathroom was very small and basic but got the job done. Moisture is an issue since the island is so humid, there was some mold on the walls in the closet and previous water damage evident. Our room had a connecting door to the room behind us and there was not much privacy, you could see a two inch gap between the bottom of the door and the floor... we could hear our neighbors quite well.
reviews.title: Marazul

reviews.text: The grounds of the resort were nice, very well landscaped. Pool was nice although seemed small for the size of the resort. This was not an issue for us since we were not there during high season and the hotel was only half full. The beach & swimming area were nice and well maintained although also not very big.
reviews.title: great place,great people, amazing water!!

reviews.text: We loved the bar out on the pier and the all-inclusive deal. Sometimes the music was too loud, but not too annoying. Food in the restaurants was basic but pretty good, you can make reservations to eat at the other Decameron resorts on the island so we did that two nights. We chose Rocky Key and the Aquarium hotel and liked them both. No one in our group ever got sick -- despite a few coconut drinks purchased roadside.
reviews.title: Awesome vacation in San Andres

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were the only north americans we met vacationing there, seemed most of the guests were from south or central america.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of you have been waiting for my review! Here it is: just skip to the appropriate section for info. Enjoy!
reviews.title: If You're Going To Stay Anywhere, Stay At The Marazul! Take My Word For It!

reviews.text: SAN ANDRES NOVEMBER 8-15 2007
reviews.title: San Andres Marazul - Good time, great value

likes.liked: — Small and quiet, right on beach

reviews.text: BOOKING: ITRAVEL NOLITOURS PACKAGE, departure tax is included in spite of what the travel agent says.
reviews.title: Just a couple things to add
I will never go back.
reviews.text: AIRPORT TRANSFER: was a bit disorganized. Instead of a shuttle, the method is to send four people in a taxi to the hotel (prepaid for you). FYI: It's not a first-come-first serve! It's more of a, "Wait here until we find another couple to send you with."

CHECK IN: Short ride to the hotel, greeted with dancers and escorted into the air conditioned lobby where we were served a delicious welcome cocktail. The glasses are rimmed with blue curacao and sugar--you'll get it all over your face. It took all of two minutes for keys, room assignment, and to be escorted to the room.
reviews.title: Amazing

aka: Super Decameron Marazul Hotel San Andres Island
